Comments_List: I learned Spanish language and culture in a more complete way than I had in high school. I grew more confident in my ability to speak and understand Spanish.
I can speak Spanish MUCH better now then before
I learned more about the cultural aspects of the language.
I learned about different tenses and a lot of vocabulary.

As a seminar class, this class does a great job of relying on student involvement and participation. The material picked off where Spanish L1 left off, but starting from the middle of the textbook was not a challenge. The teacher went over grammar, assignments, and examples in class so that every student understood the material. I feel like I really started to learn Spanish for the first time in this course.

The cultural connections from this class are fantastic. Its really cool to learn about different spanish-speaking countries and how they differ from one another, but the actual learning of grammar and vocabulary is only used in the context of the textbook. I wish there were more vocab/grammar activities that were used to synthesize my learning.
A different cheaper textbook could be used! But otherwise, the class was taught super well!
The course helps the student better immerse into the culture of the language based on the works of authors we studied. It can be improved by having more writing assignments.
This course was good, I learned a lot, and it could be improved by giving out project or group work assignment further in advance.

I would not recommend this course to someone who has taken quite a bit of high school spanish unless they plan to really commit themselves to the course. I was bored by the subject material and wish I had petitioned to be in L3.
Yes!! Learning Spanish is really important
Yes, it really helps you learn not only tenses and grammatical aspects of the language but also immerses the student in the culture of the language.
Yes, the professor was good and the material is fairly easy to grasp and apply.
